task.title: Connect Capacitor to Tone Potentiometer
task.shortdesc: Solder the capacitor between the tone potentiometer's center lug and casing to enable tone control.

step.cmd: Solder one capacitor lead to lug 2 of the tone potentiometer.

info.note: Either lead can connect to lug 2 because this capacitor is non-polarized.

step.cmd: Solder the other capacitor lead to the tone potentiometer casing.

substep.cmd: Bend the free capacitor lead against the potentiometer casing so it lies flat.
Solder the bent lead to the back of the casing.

image.alt: Diagram showing the tone pot side view with parallel capacitor leg

stepresult.note: The image shows how the capacitor leg should be positioned and soldered to the pot casing.

image.alt: Diagram showing the capacitor wire placement in relation to the rest of the electronics

result.p: The capacitor is now connected to the tone potentiometer.
